word_mean: 惊厥的，以惊厥为特征的，惊厥性的

sentence.Network_en: He could no longer hold back convulsive laughter.
sentence.Network_cn: 他再也忍不住，前俯后仰地大笑起来。

sentence.Network_en: She burst into a convulsive sobs.
She thought she could never stop until convulsive sobs racked her even more.
sentence.Network_cn: 要不是自己已经泣不成声，她想她可能永远也不会停下来。

热性惊厥(febrile convulsion)，由于绝大多数患儿是在体温突然和显著增高时发作，国内习惯使用高热惊厥名称。本病是婴幼儿最常见 …

entry.tran: 突然的;不能自控的;不由自主地
entry.def: A convulsive movement or action is sudden and cannot be controlled.

example.ex: She thought she could never stop until convulsive sobs racked her even more.
example.tran: 要不是自己已经泣不成声，她想她可能永远也不会停下来。

means.word_mean: 1. affected by involuntary jerky muscular contractions; resembling a spasm;
2. resembling a convulsion in being sudden and violent;

auth_sentence.content: He gave a convulsive wrench of his whole body.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 起痉挛的, 痉挛性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: convulse[v.使震动,震惊;使抽筋]+ive……的→adj.起痉挛的, 痉挛性的
convulse[v.使震动,震惊;使抽筋]+ion表名词→n.骚动,痉挛
revulse[v.使极其厌恶, 激起……的强烈反感]+ion表名词→n.抽回;反感;厌恶
con一起+vuls收缩,撕开+e→使收缩到一起→使抽筋

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使极其厌恶, 激起……的强烈反感
stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+vuls收缩,撕开+e→收缩回去→对……反感
